entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Westerly winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary: Squally thunderstorms embedded in a strong westerly flow are expected to affect the lower North Island this afternoon and evening. Squally winds of 90 to 110 km/h are expected with these thunderstorms, and there is a moderate risk of SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS from the Kapiti Coast to Whanganui producing damaging winds with gusts greater than 110 km/h. Wind gusts of this strength can cause some structural damage, including trees and power lines, and may make driving hazardous.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow is expected to lower to 600 metres for a time this afternoon. 2 to 5 cm may accumulate about the summit, with lesser amounts lower down.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow showers are expected to affect the road till evening. 3 to 5 cm may accumulate about the summit with lesser amounts lower down.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow showers are expected to affect the road above 800 metres from Wednesday evening. 1 to 3 cm may accumulate on the summit, with lesser amounts lower down.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow is expected to lower to 600 metres this afternoon and evening. 5 to 8 cm may accumulate about the summit, with lesser amounts lower down.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow is expected to affect the road today. 10 to 15 cm may accumulate above 800 metres till early evening, with lesser amounts down to 500 metres. In the evening, snow showers become confined south of Lake Gunn where a further 1 to 2 cm may accumulate on the road above 300 metres.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow is expected to lower to 600 metres for a time this afternoon and evening. 2 to 4 cm may accumulate about the summit and lesser lower down.
